titles: The history of the famous and passionate love, between a fair noble Parisian lady, and a beautiful young singing-man, a chanter in the Quire of Notre Dame in Paris, and a singer in opera's an heroic poem, in two canto's, being in imitation of Virgil's Dido and Ã†nes, and shews all the passions of a proud beauty, compell'd by love, to abandon her self to her inferiour : but finding some slights, how she reveng'd her self, and recovered her honor.
author: Crown, Mr. (John), 1640?-1712.
Virgil. Aeneis. Liber 2-4.
notes: Attributed to John Crowne.  Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
